00043 DmetCopyNumberEngine * DmetCopyNumberEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00044 {
00045         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == DmetCopyNumberEngine::EngineName())
00046                 return (DmetCopyNumberEngine *)engine;
00047         return NULL;
00048 }
00049 
00050 double DmetCopyNumberEngine::minDouble(double a, double b) { return (a<=b) ? a : b; }
00051 
00052 double DmetCopyNumberEngine::maxDouble(double a, double b) { return (a>b) ? a : b; }
00053 
00054 double DmetCopyNumberEngine::Log2(double input) { return ( log(input) / log(2.0) ) ; }

00056 void DmetCopyNumberEngine::parseRegionDataFile(string regionDataFileName, DmetCopyNumberData &copyNumberData ){
00057 
00058   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00059   if(tsv.open(regionDataFileName) != affx::TSV_OK)
00060       Err::errAbort("Unable to open region file '"+regionDataFileName+"'");
00061   while(tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK){
00062     string inputString;
00063     double inputDouble;
00064 
00065     if(tsv.get(0,"region",inputString)==TSV_OK)
00066       copyNumberData.addRegion(inputString);
00067     else
00068       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: region.");
00069 
00070     if(tsv.get(0, "nocall_prob", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00071       copyNumberData.setNoCallProbability(inputString, inputDouble); 
00072     else
00073       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: nocall_prob.");
00074 
00075     if(tsv.get(0, "outlier_prob", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00076       copyNumberData.setOutlierProbability(inputString, inputDouble); 
00077     else
00078       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: outlier_prob.");
00079 
00080     if(tsv.get(0, "prior_0", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00081       copyNumberData.setPrior_0(inputString, inputDouble); 
00082     else
00083       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: prior_0.");
00084 
00085     if(tsv.get(0, "prior_1", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00086       copyNumberData.setPrior_1(inputString, inputDouble); 
00087     else
00088       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: prior_1.");
00089 
00090     if(tsv.get(0, "prior_2", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00091       copyNumberData.setPrior_2(inputString, inputDouble); 
00092     else
00093       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: prior_2.");
00094 
00095     if(tsv.get(0, "s_01_0", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00096       copyNumberData.setS_01_0(inputString, inputDouble); 
00097     else
00098       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: s_01_0.");
00099 
00100     if(tsv.get(0, "m_01_0", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00101       copyNumberData.setM_01_0(inputString, inputDouble); 
00102     else
00103       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: m_01_0.");
00104 
00105     if(tsv.get(0, "s_01_1", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00106       copyNumberData.setS_01_1(inputString, inputDouble); 
00107     else
00108       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: s_01_1.");
00109 
00110     if(tsv.get(0, "m_01_1", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00111       copyNumberData.setM_01_1(inputString, inputDouble); 
00112     else
00113       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: m_01_1.");
00114 
00115     if(tsv.get(0, "s_12_1", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00116       copyNumberData.setS_12_1(inputString, inputDouble); 
00117     else
00118       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: s_12_1.");
00119 
00120     if(tsv.get(0, "m_12_1", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00121       copyNumberData.setM_12_1(inputString, inputDouble); 
00122     else
00123       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: m_12_1.");
00124 
00125     if(tsv.get(0, "s_12_2", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00126       copyNumberData.setS_12_2(inputString, inputDouble); 
00127     else
00128       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: s_12_2.");
00129 
00130     if(tsv.get(0, "m_12_2", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00131       copyNumberData.setM_12_2(inputString, inputDouble); 
00132     else
00133       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: m_12_2.");
00134 
00135     if(tsv.get(0, "n_0", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00136       copyNumberData.setN_0(inputString, inputDouble); 
00137     else
00138       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: n_0.");
00139 
00140     if(tsv.get(0, "n_1", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00141       copyNumberData.setN_1(inputString, inputDouble); 
00142     else
00143       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: n_1.");
00144 
00145     if(tsv.get(0, "n_2", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00146       copyNumberData.setN_2(inputString, inputDouble); 
00147     else
00148       Err::errAbort("Unable to parse region file: missing column: n_2.");
00149     
00150   }
00151 }
00152 
00153 void DmetCopyNumberEngine::parseProbeSetDataFile(string probeSetDataFileName, DmetCopyNumberData &copyNumberData ){
00154 
00155   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00156   if(tsv.open(probeSetDataFileName) != affx::TSV_OK)
00157       Err::errAbort("Unable to open region file '"+probeSetDataFileName+"'");
00158   while(tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK){
00159     string inputString1, inputString2;
00160     double inputDouble;
00161 
00162     if(tsv.get(0,"probeset_id",inputString1)==TSV_OK){
00163 
00164       if(tsv.get(0, "region", inputString2)==TSV_OK)
00165         copyNumberData.addPredictionProbeSet(inputString2, inputString1); 
00166       else
00167         Err::errAbort("Unable to parse probeset model file: missing column: retion.");
00168 
00169       if(tsv.get(0, "m_0", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00170         copyNumberData.setMean_0(inputString1, inputDouble); 
00171       else
00172         Err::errAbort("Unable to parse probeset model file: missing column: m_0.");
00173 
00174       if(tsv.get(0, "m_1", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00175         copyNumberData.setMean_1(inputString1, inputDouble); 
00176       else
00177         Err::errAbort("Unable to parse probeset model file: missing column: m_1.");
00178 
00179       if(tsv.get(0, "m_2", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00180         copyNumberData.setMean_2(inputString1, inputDouble); 
00181       else
00182         Err::errAbort("Unable to parse probeset model file: missing column: m_2.");
00183 
00184       if(tsv.get(0, "w01", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00185          copyNumberData.setW_01(inputString1, inputDouble); 
00186        else
00187         Err::errAbort("Unable to parse probeset model file: missing column: w01.");
00188 
00189       if(tsv.get(0, "w12", inputDouble)==TSV_OK)
00190         copyNumberData.setW_12(inputString1, inputDouble); 
00191       else
00192         Err::errAbort("Unable to parse probeset model file: missing column: w12.");
00193     } else // This else is for the failure to get the first inputString2. 
00194         Err::errAbort("Unable to parse probeset model file: missing column: probeset_id.");
00195   }// end loop for nextLevel.
00196   
00197     
00198 }

00200 
00201 void DmetCopyNumberEngine::parseCNRegionGenotypeProbesetFile(string cn_region_gt_marker_filename, DmetCopyNumberData &copyNumberData) {
00202   affx::TsvFile cn_region_gt_markers;
00203   if ( cn_region_gt_markers.open(cn_region_gt_marker_filename) != TSV_OK ) {
00204     Err::errAbort(cn_region_gt_marker_filename + ": failed to open CN region genotype probesets file.");
00205   }
00206   else {
00207     while (cn_region_gt_markers.nextLevel(0) == TSV_OK) {
00208       string probeset;
00209       string region;
00210       if(cn_region_gt_markers.get(0, "probeset_id", probeset) != TSV_OK){
00211         Err::errAbort(cn_region_gt_marker_filename + ": cannot read probeset field.");
00212       }
00213       if(cn_region_gt_markers.get(0, "region", region) != TSV_OK){
00214         Err::errAbort(cn_region_gt_marker_filename + ": cannot read CN region field.");
00215       }
00216 
00217       copyNumberData.addGenotypeProbeSet(region, probeset);
00218     }
00219   }
00220 }
00221 
00222 //  Calculates the copyNumber value by interpolating probeSet intensity values between known CN0 and CN1 intensity
00223 //  values.  Then take a weighted sum over all the probeSets. 
00224  
00225 double DmetCopyNumberEngine::calculate01CopyNumberEstimate(string region, 
00226             set<string> probeSetNames, string sampleName,
00227             const DmetCopyNumberData &copyNumberData){
00228  
00229   double slope=0.0; 
00230   double cumulativeSampleSum=0.0;
00231 
00232   cumulativeSampleSum=0.0;
00233  
00234   set<string>::iterator beginProbeSet=probeSetNames.begin();
00235   set<string>::iterator endProbeSet=probeSetNames.end();
00236 
00237   for( ; beginProbeSet!=endProbeSet; beginProbeSet++){
00238     string probeSetName = *beginProbeSet;
00239 
00240     slope=maxDouble(0.000001, copyNumberData.getMean_1(probeSetName) - copyNumberData.getMean_0(probeSetName));            
00241     cumulativeSampleSum+= ( ( (copyNumberData.getSampleProbeSetIntensity(sampleName, probeSetName) - 
00242                                 copyNumberData.getMean_0(probeSetName)) / slope) * 
00243                                 copyNumberData.getW_01(probeSetName));
00244 
00245 /* Debugging
00246   double mean0 = copyNumberData.getMean_0(probeSetName);
00247   double mean1 = copyNumberData.getMean_1(probeSetName);
00248   double intensity = copyNumberData.getSampleProbeSetIntensity(sampleName, probeSetName);
00249   double w_01 =  copyNumberData.getW_01(probeSetName);
00250 */
00251          
00252    } 
00253     
00254   return cumulativeSampleSum;
00255 
00256 }
00257 
00258 
00259 double DmetCopyNumberEngine::calculate12CopyNumberEstimate(string region, 
00260     set<string> probeSetNames, string sampleName,
00261     const DmetCopyNumberData &copyNumberData){
00262  
00263   double slope=0.0; 
00264   double cumulativeSampleSum=0.0;
00265 
00266   cumulativeSampleSum=0.0;
00267  
00268   set<string>::iterator beginProbeSet=probeSetNames.begin();
00269   set<string>::iterator endProbeSet=probeSetNames.end();
00270   for( ; beginProbeSet!=endProbeSet; beginProbeSet++){
00271 
00272     slope=maxDouble(0.000001, copyNumberData.getMean_2(*beginProbeSet) - copyNumberData.getMean_1(*beginProbeSet));            
00273     cumulativeSampleSum+= ( ( 1.0 + ( (copyNumberData.getSampleProbeSetIntensity(sampleName, *beginProbeSet) - 
00274         copyNumberData.getMean_1(*beginProbeSet)) / slope) ) * 
00275         copyNumberData.getW_12(*beginProbeSet));
00276     } 
00277     
00278   return cumulativeSampleSum;
00279 
00280 }
00281 
00282 
00283 double DmetCopyNumberEngine::calculateCNDensity( double inputValue,
00284         double mean, double stDeviation, double degFreedom){
00285 
00286   if(degFreedom < 3)
00287     Err::errAbort("DmetCopyNumberengine::calculateCNDensity: deg freedom < 3");
00288   degFreedom = maxDouble(3.0, (degFreedom-1.0));
00289   double aa = pow((degFreedom/(degFreedom-2.0)), 0.5)/stDeviation;
00290   double ww = aa*(inputValue - mean);
00291   double output = (aa * affxstat::tDistribution(ww, degFreedom));
00292   return output;
00293  
00294 }
00295   
00296 int DmetCopyNumberEngine::findMaxIndex(const vector<double> inputVector){
00297   if(inputVector.size() < 1)
00298       Err::errAbort("Empty input vector in DmetCopyNumberEngine::findMaxIndex.");
00299   double presentMax = -1e-25;
00300   int maxIndex = 0;
00301   int index = 0;
00302   std::vector<double>::const_iterator begin = inputVector.begin(); 
00303   std::vector<double>::const_iterator  end = inputVector.end();
00304   for( ; begin!=end; begin++){
00305     if(inputVector[index] > presentMax){ 
00306       presentMax = inputVector[index];
00307       maxIndex = index;
00308     }
00309     index++; 
00310   }
00311   return maxIndex;
00312 }
00313 
00314 int DmetCopyNumberEngine::tailQuantileLower(const vector<double> inputVector, double pValue){
00315   if(inputVector.size() < 1)
00316       Err::errAbort("Empty input vector in DmetCopyNumberEngine::findMaxIndex.");
00317   if(pValue < 0 || pValue > 1)
00318       Err::errAbort("Invalid pvalue '"+ToStr(pValue)+"'");
00319   
00320   double cumulativeSum=0.0;
00321   for(size_t i=0; i<inputVector.size(); i++) {
00322     cumulativeSum += inputVector[i];
00323     if(cumulativeSum >= pValue)
00324       return i;
00325   }
00326   //  If the function makes it to here the sum of all the elements in the inputVector
00327   //  is still less than pValue and we return the index of the last element in the vector.
00328   return inputVector.size() - 1;
00329 } 
00330     
00331 
00332 int DmetCopyNumberEngine::tailQuantileUpper(const vector<double> inputVector, double pValue){
00333   if(inputVector.size() < 1)
00334       Err::errAbort("Empty input vector in DmetCopyNumberEngine::findMaxIndex.");
00335   if(pValue < 0 || pValue > 1)
00336       Err::errAbort("Invalid pvalue '"+ToStr(pValue)+"'");
00337 
00338 
00339   int returnIndex = inputVector.size()-1; 
00340   double cumulativeSum=0.0;
00341 
00342   vector<double>::const_reverse_iterator begin= inputVector.rbegin();
00343   vector<double>::const_reverse_iterator end= inputVector.rend();
00344   for( ; begin!=end; begin++){
00345     cumulativeSum += inputVector[returnIndex];
00346     if(cumulativeSum >= pValue)
00347       return returnIndex;
00348     returnIndex--;
00349   }
00350   //  If the function makes it to here the sum of all the elements in the inputVector
00351   //  is still less than pVal and we return the index of the first element in the vector.
00352   //  ie. 0.
00353   return 0; 
00354 } 
00355  
00356 void DmetCopyNumberEngine::parseSummaryDataFile5(string summaryDataFileName, DmetCopyNumberData &copyNumberData){
00357     string str;
00358     vector<string> sampleNames;
00359     affx::File5_File file5;
00360     file5.open(summaryDataFileName, affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00361     affx::File5_Tsv* tsv5 = NULL;
00362     tsv5 = file5.openTsv("dmet.summary", affx::FILE5_OPEN_RO);
00363     if(tsv5 == NULL)
00364         Err::errAbort("Unable to get summary data from a5 file");
00365 
00366     // get the experiment names
00367     unsigned int colCount = tsv5->getColumnCount(0);
00368     for (unsigned int colIndex = 1; (colIndex < colCount); colIndex++)
00369     {
00370         tsv5->getColumnName(0, colIndex, &str);
00371         sampleNames.push_back(str);
00372         copyNumberData.addSampleName(str);
00373         //Verbose::out(1,"Found sample '"+str+"'in summary file");
00374     }
00375 
00376     // Load up signal estimates
00377     double estimate = 0;
00378     string probeSetName;
00379     while (tsv5->nextLine() == affx::FILE5_OK) {
00380             tsv5->get(0, 0, &probeSetName);
00381             //Verbose::out(1,"Found probeset '"+probeSetName+"'in summary file");
00382             for (unsigned int colIndex = 1; colIndex < colCount; colIndex++) {
00383                 tsv5->get(0, colIndex, &estimate);
00384                 copyNumberData.setSampleProbeSetIntensity(sampleNames[colIndex-1], probeSetName, Log2(estimate));
00385                 //Verbose::out(1,"Setting sample data: " + sampleNames[colIndex-1] + ", " + probeSetName + ", " + ToStr(estimate));
00386             }
00387     }
00388 
00389     // Close/free resources
00390     tsv5->close();
00391     delete tsv5;
00392     file5.close();
00393 
00394 }
00395 
00396 void DmetCopyNumberEngine::parseSummaryDataFile(string summaryDataFileName, DmetCopyNumberData &copyNumberData){
00397 
00398   affx::TsvFile tsv;
00399   if(tsv.open(summaryDataFileName) != affx::TSV_OK)
00400       Err::errAbort("Unable to open region file '"+summaryDataFileName+"'");
00401 
00402   //  First we add the sample names to out copyNumberData data structure.
00403   int numberOfColumns = tsv.getColumnCount(0);
00404   vector<string> sampleNames;
00405   for(int i=1; i<numberOfColumns; i++){
00406     string columnName = tsv.getColumnName(0,i);
00407     copyNumberData.addSampleName(columnName);
00408     // We save the sample names for later use.
00409     sampleNames.push_back(columnName); 
00410   }    
00411 
00412   // We now loop over the probeset collecting and storing the intensity data for the 
00413   // probeset/sample values. 
00414   int columnIndex=1; 
00415   double estimate;
00416   while(tsv.nextLevel(0)==TSV_OK){
00417     string probeSetName;
00418     if(tsv.get(0,0,probeSetName)){
00419 
00420       // Note that we do not add ProbeSet names to our DmetCopyNumberData structure at this point.
00421       // That is done on reading the ProbeSet specific parameter file.  We do a check when summary
00422       // data is accessed to verify that intensity data for the probes in the ProbeSet specific 
00423       // does exist in the structure that is filled at this point. 
00424 
00425       columnIndex=1;
00426       while(columnIndex < numberOfColumns) {
00427         tsv.get(0, columnIndex, estimate);
00428         copyNumberData.setSampleProbeSetIntensity(sampleNames[columnIndex-1], probeSetName, Log2(estimate));
00429         columnIndex++;
00430       } // end of while loop over samples
00431     } // end of if
00432     else  
00433         Err::errAbort("Unable to read in summary file.");
00434   }
00435 }
00436 
00437 void DmetCopyNumberEngine::configureReport(TsvReport *tsv, affx::TsvReport::TsvReportFmt_t format, AnalysisInfo &info, const string &guid) {
00438 
00439   tsv->setDirPath(getOpt("out-dir"));
00440   tsv->setFileprefix(getOpt("set-analysis-name"));
00441   tsv->setFilename(tsv->getFileprefix()+".copynumber");
00442 
00443   tsv->setFormat(format);
00444 
00445   tsv->defineStringColumn(0,0,"cel",         TSVREPORT_CELFILE_STRLEN);
00446   tsv->defineStringColumn(0,1,"region",      TSVREPORT_PROBESET_STRLEN);
00447   tsv->defineColumn(      0,2,"cn_call",     affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT);
00448   tsv->defineColumn(      0,3,"cn_force",    affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT);
00449   tsv->defineColumn(      0,4,"cn_estimate", affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
00450   tsv->defineColumn(      0,5,"cn_lower",    affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT);
00451   tsv->defineColumn(      0,6,"cn_upper",    affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT);
00452   tsv->defineColumn(      0,7,"pvalue",      affx::FILE5_DTYPE_DOUBLE);
00453 
00454   if (tsv->writeTsv_v1()!=affx::TSV_OK) {
00455     Err::errAbort("Cant open tsv report.");
00456   }
00457 
00458    tsv->addHeader("guid",guid);
00459    std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator keyIx, paramIx;
00460    for(keyIx = info.m_ParamNames.begin(), paramIx = info.m_ParamValues.begin();
00461        keyIx != info.m_ParamNames.end() && paramIx != info.m_ParamValues.end();
00462        ++keyIx, ++paramIx) {
00463           tsv->addHeader("affymetrix-algorithm-param-" + *keyIx, *paramIx);
00464    }
00465 }
00466 
00467 void DmetCopyNumberEngine::runImp(){
00468 
00469   vector<TsvReport *> reports;
00470   vector<affx::TsvReport*> gt_probesets_rpt;
00471   try {
00472 
00473     const string analysisGuid = affxutil::Guid::GenerateNewGuid();
00474 
00475     string regionDataFileName = getOpt("region-model");
00476     string probeSetDataFileName = getOpt("probeset-model");
00477     
00478     // Meta Info For Output File
00479     AnalysisInfo info;
00480 
00481     //  Output File
00482     if(getOptBool("text-output")) {
00483         TsvReport *report = new TsvReport;
00484         configureReport(report, affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV, info, analysisGuid);
00485         reports.push_back(report);
00486     }
00487     
00488     if(getOptBool("a5-output")) {
00489         TsvReport *report = new TsvReport;
00490         configureReport(report, affx::TsvReport::FMT_A5, info, analysisGuid);
00491         reports.push_back(report);
00492     }
00493     
00494     /*
00495     affx::TsvFile tsv;
00496     string outputFileName = Fs::join(getOpt("out-dir"),"dmet-copynumber.txt");
00497     tsv.defineFile("cel\tregion\tcn_call\tcn_force\tcn_estimate\tcn_lower\tcn_upper\tpvalue");
00498     tsv.writeTsv_v1(outputFileName);
00499     */
00500     
00501     double copyNumberEstimate01=0.0;
00502     double copyNumberEstimate12=0.0;
00503     
00504     DmetCopyNumberData copyNumberData;
00505     set<string> probeSetNames;
00506     
00507    
00508     if(getOpt("summaries")!="")
00509         parseSummaryDataFile(getOpt("summaries"), copyNumberData);
00510     else if(getOpt("a5-summaries")!="")
00511         parseSummaryDataFile5(getOpt("a5-summaries"), copyNumberData);
00512     parseRegionDataFile(regionDataFileName, copyNumberData );
00513     parseProbeSetDataFile(probeSetDataFileName, copyNumberData );
00514     
00515 
00516     //  These are the samples and regions we will be examining. 
00517     vector<string> sampleNames = copyNumberData.getSampleNames();
00518     vector<string> regions = copyNumberData.getRegionNames();
00519 
00520     string cn_region_gt_marker_filename = getOpt("cn-region-gt-probeset-file");
00521     if (!cn_region_gt_marker_filename.empty()) {
00522         parseCNRegionGenotypeProbesetFile(cn_region_gt_marker_filename, copyNumberData);
00523     
00524         //  Output File Format
00525         if(getOptBool("a5-output")) {
00526             affx::TsvReport *a5 = new TsvReport();
00527             a5->setDirPath(getOpt("out-dir"));
00528             a5->setFilename(getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".gt.markers.cn.call");           a5->setFormat(affx::TsvReport::FMT_A5);
00529             gt_probesets_rpt.push_back(a5);
00530         }
00531 
00532         if(getOptBool("text-output")) {
00533             affx::TsvReport *tsv = new TsvReport();
00534             tsv->setDirPath(getOpt("out-dir"));
00535             tsv->setFilename(getOpt("set-analysis-name") + ".gt.markers.cn.call");
00536             tsv->setFormat(affx::TsvReport::FMT_TSV);
00537             gt_probesets_rpt.push_back(tsv);
00538         }       
00539 
00540         for (int it = 0; it < gt_probesets_rpt.size(); it++) {
00541             gt_probesets_rpt[it]->defineColumn(0, 0, "sample_id", affx::FILE5_DTYPE_STRING, 100);
00542             
00543             // make column headers using probeset ids
00544             int cidx = 1;
00545             for (int i = 0; i < regions.size(); i++) {
00546                 vector<string> gt_probesets = copyNumberData.getGenotypeProbeSets(regions[i]);
00547                 for (int j = 0; j < gt_probesets.size(); j++) {
00548                     gt_probesets_rpt[it]->defineColumn(0, cidx++, gt_probesets[j], affx::FILE5_DTYPE_INT);
00549                 }
00550             }
00551             
00552             // -1 is error code for TsvReport.  This will probably change,
00553             // compelling a change here as well.
00554             if (gt_probesets_rpt[it]->writeTsv_v1() != affx::TSV_OK) {
00555         Err::errAbort(gt_probesets_rpt[it]->getFilePath() + ": Unable to open for writing.");
00556             }
00557         }
00558         
00559     }
00560     
00561     //  We iterate over all samples i.e. CELL files being examined.    
00562     vector<string>::iterator sampleNamesBegin= sampleNames.begin();
00563     vector<string>::iterator sampleNamesEnd= sampleNames.end();
00564     for( ; sampleNamesBegin!=sampleNamesEnd; sampleNamesBegin++){
00565 
00566 
00567         string sampleName = *sampleNamesBegin; 
00568         if (!cn_region_gt_marker_filename.empty()) {
00569             for (int it = 0; it < gt_probesets_rpt.size(); it++) {
00570                 gt_probesets_rpt[it]->set_string(0, 0, sampleName);
00571             }
00572         }
00573         // index used for filling in the rest of the level for gt_probesets_rpt
00574         int gt_probesets_rpt_cidx = 1;
00575 
00576         // We now iterate over all CN regions.      
00577         VerboseErrHandler* errHandler=new VerboseErrHandler(true);
00578         vector<string>::iterator regionNamesBegin= regions.begin();
00579         vector<string>::iterator regionNamesEnd= regions.end();
00580         for( ; regionNamesBegin!=regionNamesEnd; regionNamesBegin++){
00581 
00582             string regionName = *regionNamesBegin; 
00583         
00584             bool error = false;
00585             string errorMsg = "";
00586 
00587             Verbose::setOutput(false);
00588             Err::pushHandler(errHandler);
00589 
00590             int copyNumberCall=-1;
00591 
00592             try {
00593     
00594                 // Some variables used in calculating CN for each region.
00595                 double sum=0.0;
00596                 double sumWithOutliers=0.0;
00597                 double copyNumberEstimate = 0.0; 
00598                 vector<double> posteriors;
00599                 vector<double> posteriorsWithOutliers;
00600     
00601                 // These are the output values needed for each Copy Number regions. 
00602                 int copyNumberForce=-1;
00603                 double pValue = 0.0; 
00604                 int copyNumberLower=-1;
00605                 int copyNumberUpper=-1;
00606     
00607                 // Set the priors from the parameter files
00608                 double prior_0 = copyNumberData.getPrior_0(regionName);
00609                 double prior_1 = copyNumberData.getPrior_1(regionName);
00610                 double prior_2 = copyNumberData.getPrior_2(regionName);
00611     
00612                 // Some local variables for calculation. 
00613                 double d_01_0 = 0.0;
00614                 double d_01_1 = 0.0;
00615                 double d_12_1 = 0.0;
00616                 double d_12_2 = 0.0;
00617                 double copyNumberEstimate_b = 0.0;
00618     
00619     
00620                 // We split the copy number determination into two sub processes.  In the first we assume that
00621                 // there is CN=2 training data and do two subdeterminatnions and choose the "best".  In the second
00622                 // case we assume that there is no CN=2 training data, so the choice is only between 0 and 1.
00623                 // Note that the variables "sum" and "posteriors" are computed in both sub processes and used
00624                 // to calculate other output.      
00625             
00626                 probeSetNames=copyNumberData.getPredictionProbeSetNamesForRegion(regionName);  
00627 
00628                 if( copyNumberData.getN_2(regionName) != 0 ){
00629                     copyNumberEstimate01= calculate01CopyNumberEstimate(regionName,
00630                                     probeSetNames, sampleName, copyNumberData);
00631     
00632                     copyNumberEstimate01 = minDouble(1.0, maxDouble(0.0, copyNumberEstimate01));
00633     
00634                     copyNumberEstimate12= calculate12CopyNumberEstimate(regionName,
00635                                     probeSetNames, sampleName, copyNumberData);
00636     
00637                     double copyNumberEstimate12_b = minDouble(2.5, copyNumberEstimate12);
00638     
00639                     d_01_0 =  calculateCNDensity(copyNumberEstimate01,
00640                         copyNumberData.getM_01_0(regionName),
00641                         copyNumberData.getS_01_0(regionName),
00642                         copyNumberData.getN_0(regionName));
00643     
00644                     d_01_1 =  calculateCNDensity(copyNumberEstimate01,
00645                         copyNumberData.getM_01_1(regionName),
00646                         copyNumberData.getS_01_1(regionName),
00647                         copyNumberData.getN_1(regionName));
00648     
00649                     d_12_1 =  calculateCNDensity(copyNumberEstimate12_b,
00650                         copyNumberData.getM_12_1(regionName),
00651                         copyNumberData.getS_12_1(regionName),
00652                         copyNumberData.getN_1(regionName));
00653     
00654                     d_12_2 =  calculateCNDensity(copyNumberEstimate12_b,
00655                         copyNumberData.getM_12_2(regionName),
00656                         copyNumberData.getS_12_2(regionName),
00657                         copyNumberData.getN_2(regionName));
00658     
00659     
00660                     double sum_01 = (prior_0*d_01_0) + ((1-prior_0)*d_01_1);
00661                     double post_gt0 = ((1-prior_0)*d_01_1)/sum_01;
00662     
00663                     sum = (prior_0*d_01_0) + (post_gt0*( (prior_1*d_12_1) + (prior_2*d_12_2) ) );
00664                     sumWithOutliers = sum + copyNumberData.getOutlierProbability(regionName);
00665     
00666                     posteriors.push_back(prior_0*d_01_0/sum);
00667                     posteriors.push_back((post_gt0*prior_1*d_12_1)/sum);
00668                     posteriors.push_back((post_gt0*prior_2*d_12_2)/sum);
00669             
00670                     posteriorsWithOutliers.push_back(prior_0*d_01_0/sumWithOutliers);
00671                     posteriorsWithOutliers.push_back((post_gt0*prior_1*d_12_1)/sumWithOutliers);
00672                     posteriorsWithOutliers.push_back((post_gt0*prior_2*d_12_2)/sumWithOutliers);
00673             
00674                     if( post_gt0 <= 0.5 || copyNumberEstimate12 < 1.0)
00675                         copyNumberEstimate = copyNumberEstimate01 ;
00676                     else
00677                         copyNumberEstimate = copyNumberEstimate12;
00678             
00679                 } else {
00680         
00681                     copyNumberEstimate = calculate01CopyNumberEstimate(regionName,
00682                             probeSetNames, sampleName, copyNumberData);
00683                     copyNumberEstimate =  maxDouble(0.0, copyNumberEstimate);
00684                     copyNumberEstimate_b = minDouble(1.0, copyNumberEstimate);
00685     
00686                     d_01_0 =  calculateCNDensity(copyNumberEstimate_b,
00687                         copyNumberData.getM_01_0(regionName),
00688                         copyNumberData.getS_01_0(regionName),
00689                         copyNumberData.getN_0(regionName));
00690     
00691                     d_01_1 =  calculateCNDensity(copyNumberEstimate_b,
00692                         copyNumberData.getM_01_1(regionName),
00693                         copyNumberData.getS_01_1(regionName),
00694                         copyNumberData.getN_1(regionName));
00695     
00696                     sum=prior_0*d_01_0 + prior_1*d_01_1;
00697                     sumWithOutliers = sum + copyNumberData.getOutlierProbability(regionName);
00698     
00699                     posteriors.push_back(prior_0*d_01_0/sum);
00700                     posteriors.push_back(prior_1*d_01_1/sum);
00701     
00702                     posteriorsWithOutliers.push_back(prior_0*d_01_0/sumWithOutliers);
00703                     posteriorsWithOutliers.push_back(prior_1*d_01_1/sumWithOutliers);
00704     
00705                 }// end else  
00706 
00707                 copyNumberForce = findMaxIndex(posteriors);
00708                 copyNumberCall = copyNumberForce;
00709 
00710                 pValue = 1-posteriorsWithOutliers[copyNumberForce]; 
00711 
00712                 ///@todo remove hack. Setting of calls should be determined using "label" field in region model file
00713                 if(copyNumberCall >= 1) {
00714                     copyNumberCall = -3;
00715                 }
00716     
00717                 copyNumberLower = tailQuantileLower(posteriors, copyNumberData.getNoCallProbability(regionName));
00718                 copyNumberUpper = tailQuantileUpper(posteriors, copyNumberData.getNoCallProbability(regionName)); 
00719     
00720                 if(copyNumberData.getNoCallProbability(regionName) < pValue)
00721                     copyNumberCall = -1;
00722     
00723                 posteriors.erase(posteriors.begin(), posteriors.end());
00724                 posteriorsWithOutliers.erase(posteriorsWithOutliers.begin(), posteriorsWithOutliers.end());
00725     
00726                 // Write out the results
00727                 for(int i=0; i<reports.size(); i++) {
00728                     reports[i]->set_string(0, 0, sampleName);
00729                     reports[i]->set_string(0, 1, regionName);
00730                     reports[i]->set_i(     0, 2, copyNumberCall); 
00731                     reports[i]->set_i(     0, 3, copyNumberForce); 
00732                     reports[i]->set_d(     0, 4, copyNumberEstimate); 
00733                     reports[i]->set_i(     0, 5, copyNumberLower); 
00734                     reports[i]->set_i(     0, 6, copyNumberUpper); 
00735                     reports[i]->set_d(     0, 7, pValue); 
00736                     reports[i]->writeLevel(0);
00737                 }
00738 
00739             }// end try-catch
00740             catch(Except &e) {
00741                 error = true;
00742                 errorMsg = e.what();
00743             }
00744             catch(...){
00745                 error = true;
00746                 errorMsg = "";
00747             }
00748             Err::popHandler();
00749             Verbose::setOutput(true);
00750 
00751             if(error) {
00752                 copyNumberCall = -1;
00753                 if(sampleNamesBegin == sampleNames.begin()) {
00754                     Verbose::out(1,"Unable to process region " + regionName + ". Most likely summary data not available/consented.");
00755                     if ( errorMsg.length() && (errorMsg.find("FATAL ERROR: ") != std::string::npos ) )
00756                       errorMsg = errorMsg.substr(errorMsg.find("FATAL ERROR: ")+13);
00757                     if(errorMsg != "")
00758                         Verbose::out(3,errorMsg);
00759                 }
00760             }
00761             if (!cn_region_gt_marker_filename.empty()) {
00762                 vector<string> gt_probesets = copyNumberData.getGenotypeProbeSets(regionName);
00763                 for (int i = 0; i < gt_probesets.size(); i++) {
00764                     // Tsvreport does not (yet) let you access
00765                     // columns by name, so a column index is used.
00766                     for (int it = 0; it < gt_probesets_rpt.size(); it++) {
00767                         gt_probesets_rpt[it]->set_i(0, gt_probesets_rpt_cidx, copyNumberCall);
00768                     }
00769                     gt_probesets_rpt_cidx++;
00770                 }
00771             }
00772 
00773             // GUI Hack -- provide a chance to cancel
00774             Verbose::out(1,"",false);
00775 
00776             error = false;
00777         }// end loop over Regions 
00778 
00779         if (!cn_region_gt_marker_filename.empty()) {
00780             for (int it = 0; it < gt_probesets_rpt.size(); it++) {
00781                 gt_probesets_rpt[it]->writeLevel(0);
00782             }
00783         }
00784     }// end loop over Samples.
00785   }
00786   catch(...) {
00787       for(int i=0; i<reports.size(); i++) {
00788           reports[i]->close();
00789           Freez(reports[i]);
00790       }
00791       reports.resize(0);
00792       for (int it = 0; it < gt_probesets_rpt.size(); it++) {    
00793           gt_probesets_rpt[it]->close();
00794           Freez(gt_probesets_rpt[it]);
00795       }
00796       gt_probesets_rpt.resize(0);
00797       throw;
00798   }
00799   for(int i=0; i<reports.size(); i++) {
00800       reports[i]->close();
00801       Freez(reports[i]);
00802   }
00803   for (int it = 0; it < gt_probesets_rpt.size(); it++) {        
00804       gt_probesets_rpt[it]->close();
00805       Freez(gt_probesets_rpt[it]);
00806   }
00807   reports.resize(0);
00808   gt_probesets_rpt.resize(0);
00809 }// end mainFunction 
00810  
00811 DmetCopyNumberEngine::DmetCopyNumberEngine() {
00812     defineOptions();
00813 }
00814 
00815 DmetCopyNumberEngine::~DmetCopyNumberEngine() {
00816 }

00822                      "Probeset summary values. ",
00823                      "");

00825                      "Probeset summary values in a5 format. ",
00826                      "");
00827   defineOption("", "region-model", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00828                      "Regions model parameters. ",
00829                      "");
00830   defineOption("", "probeset-model", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00831                      "Probeset model parameters. ",
00832                      "");
00833   defineOption("", "cn-region-gt-probeset-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT, 
00834                      "File of genotype probesets contained in copy number regions. ", "");
00835

00838                      "Generate text output file. ",
00839                      "false");

00841                      "Generate a5 output file. ",
00842                      "true");
00843 
00844   defineOptionSection("Analysis Options");
00845   defineOption("", "set-analysis-name", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00846                      "Explicitly set the analysis name. "
00847                      "This affects output file names (ie prefix) and various meta info.",
00848                      "dmet");
00849 }

00857 /**
00858  * Make sure that our options are sane. Call Err::errAbort if not.
00859  */
00860 void DmetCopyNumberEngine::checkOptionsImp() {
00861 
00862     defineStates();
00863 
00864     setLibFileOpt("region-model");
00865     setLibFileOpt("probeset-model");
00866     setLibFileOpt("cn-region-gt-probeset-file");
00867 
00868     string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00869 
00870     // setup output folder
00871     if(!Fs::isWriteableDir(outDir)) {
00872         if(Fs::mkdirPath(outDir, false) != APT_OK) {
00873             Err::errAbort("Can't make or write to directory: " + ToStr(outDir));
00874         }
00875     }
00876 
00877     ///@todo does the input summary file chip type match model files chip type
00878     ///@todo are the model files from the same set
00879     ///@todo was the input summary file summarized correctly -- ie analysis spec match that in model files
00880 
00881 }
